Technical Summary:

The markhazleton-blog repository is a sophisticated static site generator and personal blog platform designed for professional content publishing, focusing on project management, web development, and technology solutions. Built using a modern, modular web development stack with PUG templating, Bootstrap 5, and a custom Node.js build system, the project features an advanced build architecture that supports automated content generation, SEO optimization, and seamless deployment via Azure Static Web Apps. The repository demonstrates a comprehensive approach to static site generation, incorporating intelligent renderers for PUG templates, SCSS compilation, asset management, and automatic RSS/sitemap generation with robust error handling and performance considerations. Its key innovations include a unified build script with selective component building, advanced SCSS compilation supporting both legacy and modern CSS features, and a highly configurable content management approach using JSON-based metadata and modular rendering strategies. The project is particularly noteworthy for its engineering-driven approach to content publishing, providing developers and technical professionals with a flexible, maintainable platform for showcasing professional work and technical insights.
